subject: Re: [junit] parallel test directories and eclipse
msgSnippet: ... The properties for the project must include the directories: src/java src/test with the Use source folders contained in the project enabled. Mike
messageBody:
Bill de h√ìra wrote:

>Hi,
>
>Has anyone had any success getting Eclipse to understand a project
>whose junit code is organized as follows:
>
> src/
> java/
> a/b/c
> test/
> a/b/c
>
>I imagine it can be done, but I've not been able to get Eclipse to
>shut up - it says it can't find src/test's dependencies, ie the ones
>in src/java
>
>

The properties for the project must include the directories:

src/java
src/test

with the "Use source folders contained in the project" enabled.

Mike
